title: Analysis of a tangent to an implicit function

content.question: Which of the following is true about the curve <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>âˆ’</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mi>y</mi> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42C8@</annotation> </semantics> </math> at the point <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

choices.label: <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D37@</annotation> </semantics> </math> exists at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, but there is no tangent line at that point.

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D37@</annotation> </semantics> </math> exists at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the tangent line at that point is horizontal.

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D37@</annotation> </semantics> </math> exists at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the tangent line at that point is neither horizontal nor vertical.

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D37@</annotation> </semantics> </math> does not exist at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the tangent line at that point is vertical.

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D37@</annotation> </semantics> </math> does not exist at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the tangent line at that point is horizontal.

content.answer: <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D37@</annotation> </semantics> </math> does not exist at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D8E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the tangent line at that point is vertical.

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
